reference.shortdesc: Use the ux-window element to provide specifications for a window or viewport in which a user assistance topic or Web page can be displayed. The window or viewport can be referenced by the resourceid element associated with a topic or topicref element.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The ux-window element can be used anywhere within a map. If more than one ux-window element in a map has the same name attribute, the first window specification in document order with that name attribute is used.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , , and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: The value used to refer to this window definition.

The top position of the target help window, whether relative to the calling window or to the entire display. The value of this attribute is a real number optionally followed by a unit of measure from the set of pc, pt, px, in, cm, mm, em (picas, points, pixels, inches, centimeters, millimeters, and ems respectively). The default unit is px (pixels).

The left position of the target help window, whether relative to the calling window or to the entire display. The value of this attribute is a real number optionally followed by a unit of measure from the set of pc, pt, px, in, cm, mm, em (picas, points, pixels, inches, centimeters, millimeters, and ems respectively). The default unit is px (pixels).

The height of the window. The value of this attribute is a real number optionally followed by a unit of measure from the set of pc, pt, px, in, cm, mm, em (picas, points, pixels, inches, centimeters, millimeters, and ems respectively). The default unit is px (pixels).

The width of the window. The value of this attribute is a real number optionally followed by a unit of measure from the set of pc, pt, px, in, cm, mm, em (picas, points, pixels, inches, centimeters, millimeters, and ems respectively). The default unit is px (pixels).
Indicates whether the initial z-order of the target help window is on top of all windows on the desktop. Allowable values are: "yes", "no", and -dita-use-conref-target. The default value is "no".

A list of other features (size, position, scrollbars, etc.) of the window. Each feature name and value can not contain any blank space, and each feature name and value is separated by a comma or other delimiter character.

Indicates whether the window dimensions are relative to the calling window or the entire target display. The default value is "no". Allowable values are:
no The window dimensions specified on this element are absolute positions (not relative to the calling window).
yes The window dimensions specified on this element are relative to the calling window.
Indicates whether the window is initially displayed in a maximized state. Allowable values are: "yes", "no", and -dita-use-conref-target. The default value is "no".

example.title: Example
example.p: In this example, a window with a name of "csh" is defined in the map. The window name is later referenced by the ux-windowref attribute on the resourceid element.
example.codeblock: <map title="Widget Help"> <topicmeta> <ux-window id="fg23" name="csh" top="10" left="20" height="400" width="500" features="status=yes,toolbar=no,menubar=no,location=no" relative="yes" full-screen="no" /> </topicmeta> <topicref href="file_ops.dita" type="concept"> <topicref href="saving.dita" type="task" /> <topicref href="deleting.dita" type="task" /> <topicref href="editing.dita" type="task"> <topicmeta> <resourceid id="ab43" appname="ua" appid="5432" ux-context-string="idh_fileedit" ux-windowref="csh" /> </topicmeta> </topicref> </topicref> </map>
example.p: In this example, different window specifications are defined for tablet and desktop presentation:
example.codeblock: <map title="Puggles Help"> <topicmeta> <ux-window id="p76" name="ux-tablet" top="1cm" left="1cm" height="4cm" width="3cm" features="status=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,location=no" relative="no" full-screen="no" /> <ux-window id="p80" name="ux-desktop" top="5cm" left="10cm" height="16cm" width="12cm" features="status=yes,toolbar=no,menubar=no,location=yes" relative="no" full-screen="no" /> </topicmeta> <topicref href="c_puggles_intro.dita" type="concept"> <!-- ... --> </topicref> </map>
